John Lloyd

Scottish independence is one of the great confidence tricks of our time

June 12, 2020
https://capx.co/scottish-independence-is-one-of-the-great-confidence-tricks-of-our-time/ John Lloyd, writing in CapX, says: The paradox of Scottish nationalism is that it commands strong, even at times majority support – and yet the foundations for the movement are so weak…After more than three centuries, the Scots nation has become an integral part of the British state, so deeply integrated that its post-independence unravelling from the UK would make the Brexit separation look straightforward. A certain loss would be the £10-12bn a year subsidy which Scotland receives from the Treasury under the long lamented (by the relatively-deprived English regions) but apparently unreformable Barnett formula.
